intro: Justicia lavandulifolia, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue and a velvety texture. Its showy, blue-violet flowers are clustered in terminal spikes, blooming from late spring to early fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
